density.note: Less dense than water; acetone floats on water initially before dissolving

specificHeat.note: About half of water's heat capacity

latentHeatOfVaporization.note: Much lower than water (2257 kJ/kg); evaporates very easily, creating strong cooling sensation on skin

latentHeatOfFusion.note: Energy needed to melt frozen acetone

antoineCoefficients.note: Very high vapor pressure at room temperature; this is why acetone evaporates so quickly

viscosity.note: Thin, runny liquid; about 1/3 the viscosity of water

surfaceTension.note: Much lower than water (72 mN/m); spreads and penetrates easily

electricalConductivity.note: Very poor conductor; essentially an insulator

flammability.note: Extremely flammable; vapors can ignite well below room temperature

solubilityInWater.note: Fully miscible with water in all proportions; also dissolves many organic compounds
